meanings.definition: Singing or humming softly and gently.
meanings.sent1: The crooning lullaby put the baby to sleep.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the crooning melody of the song.
meanings.sent3: The crooning bird outside the window seemed to be serenading the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The crooning wind whispered through the trees, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The crooning voice of the singer filled the room with tranquility.

meanings.definition: To sing or hum in a soft, low voice.
meanings.sent1: He was crooning a sweet tune while cooking dinner.
meanings.sent2: The old man was crooning a familiar song to himself.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be crooning along with the radio.
meanings.sent4: She found herself crooning a tune absentmindedly while working.
meanings.sent5: The crooning of the choir echoed beautifully in the church.
